description: Rectilinear crossing number of complete graph on n nodes.
comments: The values a(19) and a(21) were obtained by Aichholzer et al. in 2006. The value a(18) is claimed by the Rectilinear Crossing Number project after months of distributed computing. This was confirmed by Abrego et al., they also found the values a(20) and a(22) to a(27). The next unknown entry, a(28), is either 7233 or 7234. - Bernardo M. Abrego (bernardo.abrego(AT)csun.edu), May 05 2008
references: O. Aichholzer, F. Aurenhammer and H. Krasser. Progress on rectilinear crossing numbers. Technical report, IGI-TU Graz, Austria, 2001.
D. Bienstock and N. Dean, Bounds for rectilinear crossing numbers, J. Graph Theory 17 (1993) 333-348
A. Brodsky, S. Durocher and E. Gethner, Toward the rectilinear crossing number of K_n..., Discrete Math. 262 (2003), 59-77.
M. Gardner, Crossing Numbers. Ch. 11 in Knotted Doughnuts and Other Mathematical Entertainments. New York: W. H. Freeman, 1986.
H. F. Jensen, An Upper Bound for the Rectilinear Crossing Number of the Complete Graph, J. Comb. Th. Ser. B 10, 212-216, 1971.
C. Thomassen, Embeddings and minors, pp. 301-349 of R. L. Graham et al., eds., Handbook of Combinatorics, MIT Press.

B.M. Abrego, S. Fernandez-Merchant, J. Leanos and G. Salazar, The maximum number of halving lines and the rectilinear crossing number of K_n for n <= 27, Electronic Notes in Discrete Mathematics, 30 (2008), 261-266.
O. Aichholzer, J. Garcia, D. Orden, P. Ramos, New lower bounds for the number of <= k-edges and the rectilinear crossing number of K_n. Discrete & Computational Geometry 38 (2007), 1-14.

A. Brodsky, S. Durocher and E. Gethner, The Rectilinear Crossing Number of K_{10} is 62, Electronic J. Combin., #R23, 2001.
D. Garber, The Orchard crossing number of an abstract graph
